answer.example: Bianca had to 【abandon】 the ship when it started to sink.
Since it was raining heavily, we 【abandoned】 the idea of taking a walk along the river.
Lila 【accompanied】 her best friend on a long vacation to Asia.
A thunderstorm is often 【accompanied】 by strong winds and heavy rain.
During the show, the singer was 【accompanied】 by a guitarist.
Bradley 【accomplished】 all of his goals before going home.
Despite the 【accomplishment】 of this project, it was not finished on time.
Construction of the Hsuehshan Tunnel was an impressive 【accomplishment】 that required a lot of hard work.

answer.meaning: （尤指經過努力）實現，完成，達到
answer.example: Stop fooling around, or you will never 【achieve】 anything.
Ms. Barlow was rewarded for her 【achievements】 in genetic science.
a sense of achievement
The new employee took a few days to 【acquaint】 himself with the working environment.
In addition to earning some pocket money, you can 【acquire】 some practical work experience.
Mildred agrees that it is important for children to 【acquire】 a second language.
Ms. Flora Pound encourages us to participate in all kinds of extracurricular 【activities】.
Polar bears 【adapt】 very well to the artificial environment of the zoo.
The Harry Potter movies and video games have been 【adapted】 from the books.
All the restrooms in the train station have been 【adapted】 for use by people with disabilities.
Max had no problem 【adjusting】 to the boarding school, but he still prefers the public school.
If it is too cold in this room, you can 【adjust】 the air conditioner to make yourself comfortable.
The machinist made some 【adjustments】 to the machine; the small changes helped it to run more smoothly.
After careful consideration, the board decided to 【adopt】 Philip Peterson’s plan for expanding the company.
Last year, Mr. and Mrs. Ruiz 【adopted】 the orphan; they were thrilled to add a daughter to their family.
The 【adoption】 of this new technology will greatly improve our ability to diagnose and predict lung cancer.
The highway patrol 【alerted】 the local police about the robbery and asked for help in solving the crime.
The soldier remained 【alert】. He paid attention to what was happening around him and was ready to act quickly if necessary.
The government warned the people to be on the 【alert】 for terrorist attacks.
Ms. Lynch's 【analysis】 of current international relations is accurate and reliable.
Stephanie's friend helped her 【analyze】 the problem in order to better understand it.
Albert felt dizzy after he spent the morning 【analyzing】 chemical compounds in his lab.
To whom should I send my 【application】?
Tyler's 【application】 to the university has been turned down.
The 【application】 of this technology in the school has greatly aroused the interest of our students in learning English.
Ms. Hess was 【appointed】 director of the historical society.
We decided to meet at 1 o'clock in the afternoon, and we both arrived at the 【appointed】 time.
May I please reschedule my 【appointment】 with Mr. Duran for tomorrow?
The 【appointment】 of a new sales manager has been announced; everyone thinks the boss has chosen the right person for the job.
make an appointment with sb.

answer.meaning: [U/C（常用複數）] 安排，準備工作
answer.example: Mr. Davis has made 【arrangements】 to spend the holidays with his family.
The small rooms in my new house make furniture 【arrangement】 difficult.
Let's 【assemble】 in the conference room to discuss the new product.
Victor likes to build toy robots, although it takes a lot of time to 【assemble】 all the parts.
In a democratic society, people have freedom of 【assembly】.
【assembly】 line
Each class was 【assigned】 a part of the organic garden to water and weed.
Gina was 【assigned】 to the oldest dorm, because she was a freshman.
The homework 【assignment】 is written on the blackboard.
The doctor was in Turkey on 【assignment】 for the United Nations; he was sent to investigate a local epidemic.
Ms. Bank's 【assignment】 to the London embassy was a reward for supporting the president.
Would you please 【assist】 me in getting to my seat, as I am unable to read the numbers?
Joseph 【assisted】 with preparations for the meeting. Without his help, I could not have finished on time.
After the earthquake, Casey received financial 【assistance】 from the government in order to rebuild his house.
Please 【attach】 your resume to the application and turn it in tomorrow.
Bruce 【attempted】 to write the paper in one week. Although many people thought it was an impossible task, he still wanted to try.
Sidney smelled burnt food and knew his wife's latest 【attempt】 at cooking had failed.
I am anxiously 【awaiting】 John's reply regarding the flight information.
If the man had known that danger 【awaited】, he would not have jumped into the river.
This morning, Ariel was 【awakened】 early by a clap of thunder.
The video was made to 【awaken】 people to the dangers of drug abuse.
Wayne's passion for music was first 【awakened】 by a concert he attended as a child.
Ms. Stanley asked her youngest daughter to 【behave】 like a young lady in front of the guests.
The mother told her son to 【behave】 or she would punish him.
Barton was on his best 【behavior】 when his parents visited his school.
Rats 【breed】 so quickly that we now have too many of them.
Gilbert was 【born and bred】 in a fishing culture, so he knows how to spearfish.
City hall initiated a 【campaign】 against street violence last week.
The workers are 【campaigning】 for a pay raise. They have planned some activities that should help them achieve their goal.
We threw a party last night to 【celebrate】 Edgar's promotion.
Next Wednesday is our wedding anniversary; we're going to 【celebrate】.
The party is planned in 【celebration】 of my mother's 70th birthday.
Cornell's novel is a 【celebration】 of the triumph of humanity over depravity.
We all 【cheered】 for Howard as he neared the finish line.
The good news 【cheered】 him up, giving him hope and encouragement.
When the superstar appeared on the stage, a 【cheer】 went up from the audience.
【Cheer up】! Everything will be all right.
Watering plants in the garden is one of Nathan's daily 【chores】.
The cook complained that plucking chickens is really a 【chore】; she said it is time-consuming and boring.
The college uses a student 【classification】 system to determine tuition payments; for example, graduate students pay more than undergraduate students.
How should I 【classify】 these photos, by location or by subject?
Virginia has 【combined】 her previous writings with her drawings in this new publication.
The two small hospitals will 【combine】 to form one large facility.
The teacher 【commanded】 her students to stand up.
The troops withdrew when the general gave the 【command】.
The lieutenant has 500 men under his 【command】.
Miss Lin was assigned as an oral interpreter to the visiting American delegation because of her strong 【command】 of both Chinese and English.
Scholars and experts from all over the world have been invited to attend this year's 【conference】 on drug control.
Do you know how to 【connect】 a DVD player to your television?
Some people 【connect】 black cats with bad luck.
There is something wrong with my Internet 【connection】. I can't get online.
Cynthia believes there is a 【connection】 between her skin disease and the stress she's been under.
The man 【consulted】 his lawyer because he needed advice.
The student kept 【consulting】 the reference book as he read the textbook.
They 【cooperated】 and got the job done on time. If they hadn't worked together, they wouldn't have made the deadline.
The police asked for the community's 【cooperation】 in catching the robbers as quickly as possible.
This 【cooperative】 activity will help the students learn to work together toward a shared goal.
According to the police, the suspect is being very 【cooperative】. He let them search his home and has given them all the information they wanted.
To 【cope】 with the stress of spending long hours in heavy traffic, Mr. Oreal drinks a lot of coffee.
The student 【council】 meets every Thursday evening.
According to the Bible, the 【creation】 of the world took exactly seven days.
Are you familiar with the latest 【creations】 of the top fashion designers in Paris?
Eli did a good 【deed】 by helping his mother carry the groceries into the house.
The young man rushed into the burning house to save the little girl. What a brave 【deed】!
Gloria has 【devoted】 a lot of effort to the study of African history.
Soldiers generally have good 【discipline】; they are trained to obey rules and orders.
The 【discipline】 of anthropology involves the study of human cultures.
Parents should 【discipline】 their children by establishing rules and punishing them when they misbehave.
